title: Minimization of Bandwidth for Required End-to-End Latency Implementing IRS in a 6G Network
content: The goal of the investigation is to increase coverage, which is ensure better transmission around IoT services using IRS within a two-tier 6G system comprising of one micro cell tier running beneath a macro cellular tier. As a result, the study tested and compared the reliability of traditional connectivity with IRS-enhanced connectivity in terms of upstream end-to-end latency using computer-based measuring methods. The study concluded that the implementation of IRS greatly improves coverage, which means transmission effectiveness, for 6G services.
